Function Documentation

void combination_display_verbose (  FILE *    ofile,
exp_link *    expl
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
expl  Pointer to expression list head.
Displays the expressions (and groups of expressions) that were considered to be measurable (evaluates to a value of TRUE (1) or FALSE (0) but were not hit during simulation. The entire Verilog expression is displayed to the specified output stream with each of its measured expressions being underlined and numbered. The missed combinations are then output below the Verilog code, showing those logical combinations that were not hit during simulation.

void combination_draw_line (  char *    line,
int    size,
int    exp_id
) 
 

Parameters:
line  Pointer to line to create line onto.
size  Number of characters long line is.
exp_id  ID to place in underline.
Draws an underline containing the specified expression ID to the specified line.

void combination_get_stats (  exp_link *    expl,
float *    total,
int *    hit
) 
 

Parameters:
expl  Pointer to current expression link to evaluate.
total  Pointer to total number of logical combinations.
hit  Pointer to number of logical combinations hit during simulation.
Recursively traverses the specified expression list, recording the total number of logical combinations in the expression list and the number of combinations hit during the course of simulation. An expression can be considered for combinational coverage if the "measured" bit is set in the expression.

void combination_instance_summary (  FILE *    ofile,
mod_inst *    root,
char *    parent
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
root  Pointer to node in instance tree to evaluate.
parent  Name of parent instance name.
Outputs summarized results of the combinational logic coverage per module instance to the specified output stream. Summarized results are printed as percentages based on the number of combinations hit during simulation divided by the total number of expression combinations possible in the design. An expression is said to be measurable for combinational coverage if it evaluates to a value of 0 or 1.

void combination_instance_verbose (  FILE *    ofile,
mod_inst *    root
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
root  Pointer to current module instance to evaluate.
Outputs the verbose coverage report for the specified module instance to the specified output stream.

void combination_list_missed (  FILE *    ofile,
expression *    exp,
int *    exp_id
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
exp  Pointer to expression tree to evaluate.
exp_id  Pointer to current expression ID to use.
Describe which combinations were not hit for all subexpressions in the specified expression tree. We display the value of missed combinations by displaying the combinations of the children expressions that were not run during simulation.

void combination_module_summary (  FILE *    ofile,
mod_link *    head
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
head  Pointer to link in current module list to evaluate.
Outputs summarized results of the combinational logic coverage per module to the specified output stream. Summarized results are printed as percentages based on the number of combinations hit during simulation divided by the total number of expression combinations possible in the design. An expression is said to be measurable for combinational coverage if it evaluates to a value of 0 or 1.

void combination_module_verbose (  FILE *    ofile,
mod_link *    head
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
head  Pointer to current module to evaluate.
Outputs the verbose coverage report for the specified module to the specified output stream.

void combination_report (  FILE *    ofile,
bool    verbose,
bool    instance
) 
 

Generates report output for combinational logic coverage.

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
verbose  Specifies whether or not to provide verbose information
instance  Specifies to report by instance or module.
After the design is read into the module hierarchy, parses the hierarchy by module, reporting the combinational logic coverage for each module encountered. The parent module will specify its own combinational logic coverage along with a total combinational logic coverage including its children.

void combination_two_vars (  FILE *    ofile,
expression *    exp,
int    val0,
int    val1,
int    val2,
int    val3
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
exp  Pointer to expression to evaluate.
val0  When operation is evaluated, contains result when left == 0 and right == 0
val1  When operation is evaluated, contains result when left == 0 and right == 1
val2  When operation is evaluated, contains result when left == 1 and right == 0
val3  When operation is evaluated, contains result when left == 1 and right == 1
Displays the missed combinational sequences for the specified expression to the specified output stream in tabular form.

void combination_unary (  FILE *    ofile,
expression *    exp
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer to file to output results to.
exp  Pointer to expression to evaluate.
Displays the missed unary combination(s) that keep the combination coverage for the specified expression from achieving 100% coverage.

void combination_underline (  FILE *    ofile,
expression *    exp,
char *    begin_sp
) 
 

Parameters:
ofile  Pointer output stream to display underlines to.
exp  Pointer to parent expression to create underline for.
begin_sp  Spacing that is placed at the beginning of the generated line.
Traverses through the expression tree that is on the same line as the parent, creating underline strings. An underline is created for each expression that does not have complete combination logic coverage. Each underline (children to parent creates an inverted tree) and contains a number for the specified expression.

void combination_underline_tree (  expression *    exp,
char ***    lines,
int *    depth,
int *    size,
int *    exp_id
) 
 

Parameters:
exp  Pointer to expression to create underline for.
lines  Stack of lines for left child.
depth  Pointer to top of left child stack.
size  Pointer to character width of this node.
exp_id  Pointer to current expression ID to use in labeling.
Recursively parses specified expression tree, underlining and labeling each measurable expression.
